title: India leads global market recovery, first in world to rebound from Trump tariff shock
content: Indian stock markets rebounded strongly after a long weekend. The NSE Nifty 50 index rose significantly in Mumbai. India has recovered losses from US tariffs. It is seen as a safe haven amid global market uncertainty. Strong domestic growth supports this. India may benefit from supply chain shifts away from China.

title: As US-China ties crash and burn, eyes turn towards India
content: US-China relations face a potential breakdown. Attention shifts to India as a possible replacement. China directs airlines to halt Boeing orders. This move aims to boost domestic aircraft manufacturing. The US President's tariff policies face criticism. Experts question if the US has overplayed its hand. India is seen as a potential beneficiary of the trade war.

title: TN vs guv: 'SC verdict may create imbalance in federal structure'
content: The Supreme Court's ruling on Tamil Nadu bills and governor's assent timelines is celebrated by opposition parties as a victory for federalism. The court emphasized governors must act on the advice of ministers and cannot indefinitely delay bills. While strengthening state autonomy, some experts caution about potential imbalances in the federal structure, suggesting a need for constitutional discipline.

title: 'Baseless & motivated': India snubs Pakistan's remark on new Waqf law
content: India's government has firmly dismissed Pakistan's criticism of the Waqf Amendment Act as unfounded and biased, asserting that Pakistan lacks the authority to comment on India's internal affairs. The external affairs ministry highlighted Pakistan's poor treatment of minorities and advised them to address their own issues instead of lecturing others.

title: USCIS to H-1B, Green Card applicants: Only two ways to stay in US
content: USCIS has updated its policy, effective April 2nd, to recognize only male and female biological sexes, aligning with President Trump's 2025 executive order. This reverses previous practices, determining sex based on the birth certificate issued at birth. Tricia McLaughlin from DHS stated this ensures policy aligns with biological reality and national security.

title: Who is Xavier Bartlett? PBKS' new pace sensation dismisses de Kock
content: Xavier Bartlett made a promising IPL debut for Punjab Kings, taking a wicket in his first over against KKR. Despite PBKS's batting struggles, Bartlett contributed with the bat after his impressive performance in the Big Bash League, where he was the leading wicket-taker. His recent international success, including multiple wickets, highlights his potential impact for Punjab Kings this season.

title: Trump targets Harvard's tax exempt status as varsity refuses to back down
content: Donald Trump has threatened Harvard University's tax-exempt status, accusing it of promoting "terrorist inspired/supporting 'Sickness?'" after the university refused to comply with federal directives, leading to a freeze of $2.2 billion in grants and $60 million in contracts.

title: TikTok in US brings 'alive' the 'Chinese nightmare' of Birkin
content: Chinese factories are leveraging TikTok to sell directly to American consumers, bypassing retail markups and tariffs on luxury goods. Viral videos showcase alleged factory-direct alternatives to brands like Lululemon and Louis Vuitton, sparking debate about authenticity and pricing. While luxury brands deny Chinese manufacturing, experts warn of counterfeit operations capitalizing on tariff confusion to flood Western markets with fake goods.

title: Yogi slams Mamata over Murshidabad violence; TMC hits back
content: Trinamool Congress MP Saket Gokhale strongly criticized Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's remarks on the Murshidabad violence, urging him to address the unrest in his own state. Gokhale cited the Agra incident involving a mob attack on a Rajya Sabha MP's residence.

title: Sunil Narine creates IPL history with most wickets against a single team
content: Sunil Narine achieved a significant milestone in the IPL, becoming the bowler with the most wickets against a single franchise, surpassing Umesh Yadav's record. Narine's crucial spell of 2 for 14 against Punjab Kings helped KKR dismantle their opponents for a mere 111. KKR's dominant bowling performance, led by Harshit Rana and supported by Varun Chakaravarthy, secured a comprehensive victory.

title: 26/11 Mumbai attack turning point between India-Pak ties: Jaishankar
content: S. Jaishankar criticized Pakistan's role in promoting terrorism, highlighting their double-dealing in Afghanistan and persistent "bad habits." He emphasized that the 2008 Mumbai attacks marked a turning point in India-Pakistan relations, signaling a shift in India's tolerance. Jaishankar also linked national progress to the strength and quality of a nation's universities.

title: Federal agency employees anxious as DOGE’s 'reductions in force' deadline nears
content: Federal agencies are bracing for another wave of mass layoffs mandated by the Trump administration and Elon Musk's DOGE, following previous terminations and resignations. Uncertainty is rampant as departments implement cuts, leaving employees scrambling for information and facing career-altering decisions with little guidance.

title: 10 warning signs for Indian students and professionals eyeing US
content: As US immigration policies evolve, Indian students face increasing challenges when aiming to study in the country. With rising visa rejections, stricter regulations, and heightened scrutiny over personal activities, the path to higher education in the US has become more complex. Key changes include visa revocations without notice, potential cancellation of the OPT program, and stricter visa renewal processes, making it essential for students to stay informed and prepared.

title: Top policymakers and global experts to speak on pressing issues at The Hindu Huddle
content: The theme for the Huddle, to be held in Bengaluru on May 9 and 10, is ‘India in Dialogue’; Amit Shah to deliver inaugural address

title: Extraditions tough till conditions improve in Indian prisons: Justice Madan B. Lokur
content: Justice Lokur points to U.K. court judgement denying an extradition, citing unsafe conditions in Tihar jail

title: Captive breeding comes to the rescue of Toda buffalo as its population plummets in Nilgiris
content: Officials say that the population ranged from 15,000 to 20,000 across the district a few decades ago. But a 2023 enumeration of the buffaloes in all Toda hamlets revealed that less than 1,000 animals were left. Hence, the Sheep Breeding Research Station at Sandynallah has begun a programme to help the population re-establish itself in the hills

title: How Rajinikanth’s speech impacted the political journey of an AIADMK veteran
content: On July 14, 1995, at an event to celebrate the 100-day run of Baasha, which came out under the banner of R.M. Veerappan’s Sathya Movies, Rajinikanth was critical of the “spread of bomb culture” in Tamil Nadu. Chief Minister Jayalalithaa was upset that the Minister did not deny the charge. Veerappan’s fall from power started then

title: ‘Bengal rioters given free run,’ alleges Yogi in attack on Mamata
content: Law and order has now been fully restored in Uttar Pradesh, because we know that rioters understand only one language, the language of the lathi

title: Singareni to commence coal production in Naini Block of Odisha 9 years after allotment
content: Deputy CM Bhatti Vikramarka to launch the mine virtually today; the mine has over 340 million tonnes of coal reserves, likely to last for 38 years

title: Muthalapozhi fishers restive over the slow progress in desilting the harbour mouth
content: Fisheries Minister Saji Cherian has called a meeting of stakeholders to mitigate the threat to fishers. The fishers want more dredgers to triple the quantum of sand removed daily by the company contracted by the government to desilt the harbour mouth

title: BJP MLA’s son, eight others booked for entering temple forcibly, thrashing priest in Madhya Pradesh
content: The FIR was filed on Monday against one person; BJP MLA Golu Shukla’s son Rudraksh Shukla and seven others were named in the FIR on Tuesday

title: Murshidabad remains calm, arrests climb to 221 in West Bengal
content: Amid the prevailing tensions and mounting arrests, residents of the affected areas demand permanent deployment of Central Armed Police Forces.

title: SC notice to Centre on Kerala man’s cremation by Delhi Police as kin searched for him
content: Plea sought guidelines to ensure that effective steps, including mandatory implementation of digital and biometric identification of unidentified bodies, are in place so that traumatised families could be spared such incidents in future

title: IIT, NIT placement data show job market stagnation: Congress
content: If one-fifth of the engineers at IITs are unable to find jobs, it raises concern over how the larger population of educated youth in this country is able to secure employment, says Jairam Ramesh

title: Hemant Soren Elected Jharkhand Mukti Morcha Central President
content: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren was on Tuesday elected as the central president of the ruling JMM, while his father Shibu Soren was made the "founding patron" of the party, a JMM leader said.

title: Thane Admin Warns Schools Against Refraining Students From Speaking In Marathi
content: The district authorities in Maharashtra's Thane have issued a circular, warning of taking punitive action against CBSE and ICSE-affiliated English medium and other schools if they are found prohibiting students from using Marathi inside classrooms.

title: Harvey Weinstein's Retrial On Rape, Sex Assault Charges Begins In New York
content: Disgraced Hollywood mogul Harvey Weinstein's retrial on rape and sex assault charges began Tuesday, forcing survivors who helped fire up the "#MeToo" movement to prepare to testify against him once more.

title: At 30.4 Degrees Celsius, Srinagar Records Hottest April Day In 8 Decades
content: The city on Tuesday recorded the hottest April day in nearly eight decades at 30.4 degrees Celsius which was 10.2 degrees above normal for this time of the season, officials said.

title: No Need To Waste "Precious Time" On Them: S Jaishankar's Barb At Pak
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday said the 2008 Mumbai terror attack marked a turning point in relations with Pakistan when Indians collectively felt that such behaviour from a neighbouring country could no longer be tolerated.

title: Aircraft Carriers Truman And Vinson Move In As Trump Plans To Corner Iran
content: Donald Trump is calculating his next move as he aims to corner Iran over nuclear talks between Washington and Tehran. The US President has decided to put an end to Iran's rapidly advancing nuclear programme.

title: Watch: Bulldog Joins US Senator At Committee Hearing, 'Gives Testimony'
content: A Senate Energy Committee hearing turned into a memorable moment after Senator Jim Justice brought his bulldog to a hearing on Thursday. He even placed a microphone in front of Babydog as if she were ready to give her testimony.

title: "Motivated, Baseless": India Slams Pakistan's Comments On Waqf Act
content: India on Tuesday strongly rejected Pakistan's criticism of the Waqf Amendment Act and said Islamabad should look into its own "abysmal" record in protecting the rights of minorities instead of preaching to others.

title: "Cannot Blame All Muslims...": Kiren Rijiju On Waqf Assets Occupation
content: Asserting that the Waqf Amendment Act will facilitate "justice" for everyone, Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Tuesday said that the entire Muslim community cannot be "blamed" for some Muslim leaders who occupied Waqf properties.

title: "Would Love It": Trump On Sending US 'Criminals' To El Salvador Jails
content: President Donald Trump stepped up his extraordinary threats to send Americans to foreign jails, saying Tuesday he would love to deport "homegrown" US citizens who commit violent crimes to a notorious mega-prison in El Salvador.

title: Apple Airlifted iPhones Worth $2 Billion From India Before Trump's Tariff Order
content: Apple's main India suppliers, Foxconn and Tata, shipped nearly $2 billion worth of iPhones to the United States in March, an all-time high, as the US company airlifted devices to bypass President Donald Trump's impending tariffs, customs data shows.

title: Swiggy Signs Deal With Labour Ministry, Seeks To Generate Lakhs Of Jobs
content: The Ministry of Labour and Employment has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Swiggy, one of India's largest food delivery platforms, as part of a broader initiative to strengthen employment opportunities through public-private partnershi

title: Woman Shot Dead By Lover After Argument In Delhi: Cops
content: A 20-year-old woman was allegedly shot dead by her lover following an argument in Delhi's Shahdara, police said on Tuesday.

title: Finland Developing Device To Counter Russian GPS Jamming
content: Finnish researchers are working on a device to counter jamming of satellite positioning systems, which has spiked in the country since 2022, the project leader told AFP on Tuesday.

title: Extreme Heat May Raise Risk Of Schizophrenia, Depression: Study
content: Rising temperatures may not only affect physical health, but could also increase the burden of mental and behavioural disorders (MBD) like schizophrenia and depression by almost 50 per cent by 2050, according to a new study.

title: Trump Escalates Harvard Row, Threatens To Tax It As A "Political Entity"
content: Trump said Harvard"should lose its Tax Exempt Status and be Taxed as a Political Entity" if the elite college does not agree to his demands for the college to change how it runs itself.

title: Robbers Use Toy Gun To Loot Gold From Jewellery Store In Pune: Police
content: Three robbers, brandishing a toy gun, attacked a jewellery store owner and decamped with gold worth lakhs from the establishment in Pune city on Tuesday, police said.

title: The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered is real, with release coming soon
content: Leaked screenshots have ignited excitement for The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered, suggesting significant graphical improvements over the 2006 original. While Bethesda remains silent, the images found on Virtuous' website seemingly confirm the remake's existence. Rumors point to a possible April release, with a Deluxe Edition potentially offering bonus content.

title: 'Never give up': Alan Wilkins heads to IPL after being cleared of cancer
content: Alan Wilkins, the veteran commentator, joyfully announced his recovery from throat cancer and his imminent return to India for the IPL season. Overcoming this health challenge, the 71-year-old broadcaster expressed immense gratitude and a renewed sense of youthfulness. His return to the commentary box is celebrated by fans, marking a triumphant moment in his distinguished career.

title: Investors gain Rs 18.42 lakh cr in 2 days: Reasons behind market rally
content: Indian stock markets saw a big jump. This happened after US President Trump paused some tariffs. The Sensex and Nifty both rose significantly. Investors feel more confident because of this change. India is also seen as a safe place to invest. Some sectors like auto and banking did well. People are watching to see what Trump does next with tariffs.

title: 'Attacked us, set everything on fire': Survivors recall Murshidabad horror
content: Following violent clashes in Murshidabad, West Bengal, triggered by protests against the Waqf (Amendment) Act, displaced families recount harrowing experiences of destruction and fear. Homes and businesses were attacked, leaving several dead and hundreds homeless, now seeking refuge in relief camps. Security forces have been deployed, and investigations are underway to restore peace and provide support to the affected communities.

title: National Herald case: ED charges Rahul, Sonia; Cong terms it 'state-sponsored crime'
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has filed a chargesheet against Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi concerning the National Herald case. This action follows the ED's recent initiation of proceedings to seize properties valued at over Rs 700 crore belonging to the Associated Journals Limited (AJL), a company with ties to both leaders.

title: 80M views & counting! Kashvee's video with Hardik breaks the internet
content: A video of Hardik Pandya gifting Kashvee Gautam a bat went viral. The video got over 80 million views on Instagram. Pandya promised Kashvee a custom-made bat after learning she idolised him. He fulfilled his promise before Mumbai Indians' match. Kashvee recently earned her first call-up to the Indian women's team. She performed well in the WPL 2025.

title: JD(U) stands firm on Nitish, BJP stays vague on CM choice
content: Disagreement has emerged between BJP and JD(U) after Haryana CM's remark on Bihar Assembly polls. JD(U) leaders asserted Nitish Kumar as CM for the next five years, dismissing concerns of BJP outsmarting Nitish. Deputy CM Samrat Chaudhary affirmed Nitish Kumar would retain his post. Meanwhile, Congress and RJD convened to strategize an alliance, discussing seat-sharing and poll strategy.

title: Wankhede stands to be named after Rohit Sharma, Wadekar and Pawar
content: The Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) has decided to honour cricketing legends by naming stands at the Wankhede Stadium after Rohit Sharma, Ajit Wadekar, and Sharad Pawar. Additionally, a lounge will be named after former MCA president Amol Kale. The MCA also announced an increase in the corpus for affiliated clubs, aiming to bolster grassroots cricket infrastructure in Mumbai.

title: Sshura Khan spotted visiting maternity hospital with husband Arbaaz Khan
content: Arbaaz Khan and Sshura Khan's recent visit to a maternity clinic in Mumbai has sparked pregnancy rumors. The couple, who married in December 2023, were seen together, with Arbaaz protectively escorting Sshura. This comes after their intimate wedding and Arbaaz's statements about finding fulfillment in his second marriage, with his son Arhaan sharing a warm bond with Sshura.

title: 'He became captain & everything changed': Bhajji calls Dhoni 'Baahubali'
content: MS Dhoni's explosive 26 off 11 balls propelled Chennai Super Kings to a thrilling victory over Lucknow Super Giants, reigniting his finisher persona. Harbhajan Singh lauded Dhoni's captaincy, stating it revitalised his batting and tactical acumen. Dhoni also achieved a milestone, becoming the first IPL player to complete 200 dismissals, further solidifying his legendary status.

title: 'Trump sees Modi as friend': US official on relations with India
content: US President Donald Trump regards Prime Minister Narendra Modi as a friend, according to US State Department spokesperson Margaret MacLeod. She highlighted the "joint interests" between India and the US, emphasizing collaboration on counter-terrorism, advanced technologies, and increased business opportunities.

title: Top 5 news of the day
content: The Enforcement Directorate has filed a chargesheet against Congress leaders Sonia and Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case, prompting a sharp reaction from the party, which called it a "state-sponsored crime." In other news, Assam has made Assamese the compulsory official language for government work, while India leads global market recovery after rebounding from Trump's tariff shock.

title: Move aside Musk: Meet Trump's new BFF
content: Since taking office in 2019, Bukele has disbanded checks and balances like they were Black Friday leftovers. Judges? Fired. Opposition? Mocked. Constitution? “More like a suggestion,” he said, running for a second term despite an explicit ban. And yet, his approval ratings hover between 85–90%. To many Salvadorans, the tradeoff—liberty for safety—feels worth it.

title: IPL 2025: R Smaran excited about Sunrisers Hyderabad call-up
content: Karnataka's rising star, R Smaran, has earned his first IPL call-up, joining Sunrisers Hyderabad as a replacement for the injured Adam Zampa. The 21-year-old left-handed batsman, celebrated for his impressive performances across formats last season, aims to learn from experienced players like Heinrich Klaasen and Pat Cummins. Smaran is eager to contribute and absorb knowledge from the team's seasoned lineup.

title: Is the Great Himalayan earthquake to happen soon?
content: Scientists warn of an impending "Great Himalayan Earthquake," potentially exceeding magnitude 8, posing a significant threat to northern India due to accumulated tectonic pressure. With 59% of India vulnerable to seismic activity, experts emphasize the urgent need for preparedness.

title: 'Delayed, not denied': Air India on Vir Das's wheelchair claim
content: Comedian Vir Das has publicly criticized Air India for a disappointing travel experience. Despite paying a premium for their Delhi flight, he and his wife, recovering from a foot fracture, encountered broken amenities and a lack of assistance.

title: Will Trump's funding freeze truly impact Harvard University?
content: The Trump administration's proposed federal funding freeze raises concerns about its impact on universities, especially elite institutions like Harvard. While many universities may struggle, Harvard’s substantial endowment and diverse revenue streams provide resilience against such disruptions. With federal funding accounting for a small percentage of its overall revenue, Harvard is well-equipped to handle a freeze. Legal challenges are delaying the freeze’s implementation, but Harvard's financial strength ensures its research and operations remain stable despite external funding uncertainties.

title: Ruling front and Opposition seek to undermine BJP’s dalliance with Church leadership over Munambam
content: LDF and UDF seek to capitalise on Union Minister Kiren Rijiju’s statement that the Waqf Act 2025 offered no sure-fire solution to  residents of Munambam locked in property ownership dispute with  Waqf Board

title: MUDA case: Special court defers decision on ‘B’ report filed by Lokayukta police giving clean chit to CM Siddaramaiah and wife
content: It allows further probe to fix responsibility on former MUDA commissioners for causing loss to exchequer by illegal allotment of sites, including 14 sites allotted CM’s wife

title: Shibu Soren appoints son and Jharkhand CM Hemant JMM chief; BJP criticises family politics
content: My father established the party as a regional movement, and now it is my responsibility to take it to the national level, says Hemant Soren

title: It has become a practice for GHMC to permit illegal structures, then regularise them: Justice C.V. Bhaskar Reddy
content: The judge directed both the GHMC Commissioner and HMDA Commissioner to appear before the Bench personally if they fail to furnish the report by July 2

title: Bodies of two teens retrieved from Godavari river at Dowleswaram barrage
content: Prakash Kumar and Harsha drowned at Vijjeswaram while bathing; bodies found after delayed search in deep waters

title: Ayodhya Ram Temple receives warning of security threat, probe initiated
content: The Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra Trust received the warning in the mail. The trust was already planning to build a four kilometre security wall around the Ram temple

title: State will fully support Central Tribal University construction, says Naidu
content: Vice-Chancellor T.V. Kattimani and Dean M. Sharath meet the Chief Minister at the Secretariat and  discuss the progress of construction and the current situation on site

title: Congress govt. following divide and rule policy through unscientific caste census, says Vijayendra
content: Criticising the rising prices of essential commodities, he says that the caste census issue has been raised to divert people’s attention from it

title: Omar Abdullah distances from party MLAs adjournment motion over Waqf Act
content: J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah called the adjournment motion brought about by National Conference members as “a mistake”

title: Maharashtra Minister dismisses rumours of rift in coalition, calls disagreements ‘natural’
content: BJP leader Chandrakant Patil’s comments come amid speculation that Deputy CM Eknath Shinde raised concerns with Union Home Minister Amit Shah about his counterpart Ajit Pawar, who heads the NCP faction in the government

title: ED to intervene in plea to quash CBI case booked against K.N. Nehru’s brother
content: Justice M. Nirmal Kumar grants time till June 12 for ED Special Public Prosecutor N. Ramesh to file the intervening petition

title: Anti-Waqf law protests will not be allowed: Assam CM
content: Any group can challenge the amendment in the Supreme Court instead of fighting it out on the streets, says Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: INSV Tarini with two women Naval officers departs Cape Town on final leg of global circumnavigation
content: Two Indian Navy women officers, Lieutenant Commander Dilna K. and Lieutenant Commander Roopa A., have begun the final, homeward leg of their global circumnavigation aboard INSV Tarini, departing Cape Town for Goa on Tuesday

title: Cabinet nod for allotment of 21.16 acres for 99 paise to TCS in Vizag
content: TCS to invest ₹1,370 crore in the unit to be set up at IT Hill No. 3 Visakhapatnam to create 12,000 jobs; WMinister Nimmala Ramanaidu says the Cabinet decided to allot lands to IT companies to encourage investments in Andhra Pradesh

title: RJD MLC “digitally arrested” for hours in Bihar
content: Cyber criminal posing as Mumbai Police officer allegedly threatened Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) MLC Mohammad Qari Sohaib with death and confined him to his residence for hours in a ‘digital arrest’, coercing him into sharing personal details.

title: US Tariffs On China 'Rare Opportunity' For Indian Tools Industry: Niti Aayog
content: The US tariffs on China and rising costs offer a rare opportunity to India to redefine its role in the global tools export market, a Niti Aayog report has stated.

title: Congress MLA Partap Singh Bajwa Appears Before Cops Over '50 Bombs' remark
content: Senior Congress leader Partap Singh Bajwa on Tuesday appeared before police in connection with an FIR registered against him over his "50 bombs have reached Punjab" statement.

title: Israel Proposes Gaza Ceasefire, Hamas Says "Will Respond Within 48 Hours"
content: Nearly a month after Israel resumed its aerial and ground assaults across Gaza to pressure Hamas into releasing the remaining hostages in the territory, the Palestinian armed group says it had received a new ceasefire proposal from Israel.

title: 'Not a crime to be out of form, but ...': Ex-cricketer on Rohit Sharma
content: Rohit Sharma's underwhelming performance at the start of IPL 2025 is impacting the Mumbai Indians' campaign, according to Anjum Chopra. With MI struggling and Rohit's low scores leading to an "Impact Player" role, Chopra suggests a change in batting order might alleviate pressure and reignite his form, despite acknowledging his proven match-winning capabilities.

title: From Ranveer Allahbadia to Urvashi Rautela : Top 5 entertainment news of the day
content: The entertainment world is buzzing with news as Ranveer Allahbadia faces cyber officials in Mumbai over controversial content. Meanwhile, Nadia Khan criticizes Hania Aamir's career choices amidst 'Sardaar Ji 3' rumors. Urvashi Rautela's cryptic social media post sparks a potential feud with Tamannaah Bhatia, and Randeep Hooda reflects on past film rejections due to his ego.

title: 'Neither optimistic nor pessimistic': Khamenei on nuclear talks with US
content: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei expressed cautious optimism regarding nuclear talks with the US, acknowledging effective initial stages while maintaining skepticism. He advised against over-reliance on the talks' outcome. Despite Trump's frustration over slow progress and warnings of potential airstrikes, Iran insists the next round will occur in Oman, amidst escalating nuclear program concerns.

title: 'Wicket dekha, maar diya': Dhoni on his 'no-look' run-out. Watch
content: Chennai Super Kings defeated Lucknow Super Giants in a recent IPL match. After the match, Rishabh Pant and MS Dhoni engaged in a lighthearted conversation. Dhoni discussed his spectacular run out of Abdul Samad. Zaheer Khan was also seen mimicking Dhoni's underarm action. Pant jokingly expressed his fear of being run out by Dhoni.

title: India, US to begin talks on trade agreement this week
content: India and the United States are commencing discussions this week for a Bilateral Trade Agreement, starting virtually before an in-person meeting in May. This follows Prime Minister Modi and President Trump's agreement to strengthen ties, aiming to finalize the trade deal by fall. Both nations seek to expand bilateral trade to $500 billion by 2030.

title: CM Himanta declares Assamese compulsory official language for govt works
content: Assam has mandated Assamese as the compulsory official language for all government communications, including notifications and orders, as announced by chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma. Bengali and Bodo will be used in the BTR and Barak Valley districts, respectively. English will remain for communication with the central government, but in case of interpretation differences, the English version will prevail.

title: India's retail inflation logs 3.34% in March 2025, nearly 6-year low
content: India's retail inflation hit a near six-year low of 3.34% in March, fueled by cheaper vegetables and protein-rich foods. This drop follows a recent repo rate cut by the RBI, which forecasts a 4% average CPI inflation for fiscal year 2025-26. Wholesale price inflation also decreased to a six-month low of 2.05%, driven by lower vegetable and essential food prices.

title: "He cared so much about my looks and it was not ok": Melinda Gates opens up on a toxic romance
content: Melinda French Gates revealed a past toxic relationship during college significantly impacted her self-esteem, particularly concerning her body image, which lingered into her thirties. Overcoming these issues through therapy and focusing on her daughters' well-being, she now prioritizes fitness for overall health rather than adhering to specific weight goals.

title: China orders halt to Boeing jet deliveries as trade war with US intensifies
content: Amid trade tensions with the US, China has reportedly instructed its airlines to halt further Boeing aircraft deliveries and U.S. parts purchases following retaliatory tariffs. This move puts Boeing in a precarious position within a crucial market, where China is projected to represent 20% of global aircraft demand.

title: 'One has to be careful': SC on HC's rape victim ‘invited trouble’ remark
content: The Supreme Court has cautioned judges against making inappropriate remarks in sexual violence cases, specifically addressing comments made by the Allahabad High Court that blamed a woman for inviting the alleged rape. This follows the Supreme Court's intervention in another Allahabad High Court case where the court diminished the severity of sexual assault against a child.

title: Fast and furious: Woman slaps toll worker 7 times in 4 seconds
content: A woman was caught on CCTV assaulting a toll booth operator at the Chhijarsi Toll Plaza in Hapur after her FASTag showed insufficient balance. The woman slapped and attempted to strangle the attendant, while two men accompanying her misbehaved with staff. Police have registered a case and are working to locate the woman involved in the incident.

title: Why Harvard's $53.2 billion endowment may not save it from Trump
content: Harvard University is in conflict with the Trump administration, which froze $2.2 billion in federal grants due to ideological disagreements. Harvard refuses to comply with demands to alter admissions policies and eliminate DEI programs, citing academic freedom. While facing financial strain and legal challenges, Harvard is standing firm against what it views as governmental overreach.

title: ED to look into money laundering angle in CMRL pay-off case
content: Copy of the final complaint filed by Serious Fraud Investigation Office in the case was handed over to ED officials on Tuesday

title: Bengali new year celebrations muted by simmering tensions in Murshidabad
content: A time for brisk sales, shops in violence-hit areas of Murshidabad’s Dhulian municipality and its surrounding areas remained closed, with only a few owners daring to open their shutters

title: Political climate heats up in Punjab as parties involved in showdown
content: Congress workers and leaders stage demonstration in Mohali against the ruling Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) for registering an FIR against Congress leader Partap Singh Bajwa

title: Common facility centre for printing units to come up near Thuraiyur
content: The brainchild of a group of about 10 printers from Thuraiyur, the facility is being set up with the support of State and Union governments and an SPV has already been floated

title: New Minor Mineral Policy will revive 2000 units, aid 2 lakh workers: FEMMI
content: The new AP mining policy promises revival of 2,000 units, aiding 2 lakh workers and boosting the State’s economic growth

title: J&K court issues proclamation notice against Hizb chief Syed Salahuddin in 2002 ‘murder case’
content: The court was informed that the accused, who is a resident of Banpora, Soibugh, and Budgam, was “evading arrest since the incident” and reports suggested he was currently residing in Pakistan Occupied Kashmir

title: ED searches Congress leader Pratap Singh Khachariyawas’s residence in Jaipur
content: ED probe linked to an ₹48,000-crore investment scam; Former Rajasthan Minister Khachariyawas calls it ‘politically motivated’

title: Congress to lead peace march in Nagpur after communal violence
content: The peace initiative comes after the disturbances that erupted across parts of the city triggered by rumours about the desecration of a religious text

title: A Telangana district where 98% of 30+ population were screened for diabetes
content: The screening drive, titled ‘Mission Madhumeha’ (diabetes), was conducted from October 2024 to March 31, 2025, to assess the prevalence of diabetes in the 30+ age group

title: ‘Kumbhotsavam’ performed at Srisailam temple
content: The rituals involved the offering of lemon, pumpkin, coconuts and cooked rice to Goddess Bhramaramba as ‘Satvika Bali’

title: Mega job fair today in Kalaburagi expected to provide one lakh jobs
content: As many as 280 companies are participating, while over 22,000 candidates have already registered for the event at KCT College Grounds

title: Kerala capital to have one more ‘night street’ at Palayam
content: Work is currently ongoing on either side of the short stretch beginning from the main gate of the University College to the University Library

title: Statue of Biju Patnaik set on fire in Odisha’s Balangir district, CM assures action
content: Chief Minister Mohan Majhi expressed deep anguish over the incident while BJD said insulting Biju Patnaik’s legacy was becoming increasingly frequent across the State

title: Kadapa police recover 602 stolen mobiles worth ₹1.8 crore
content: 4,670 mobile phones worth ₹9.2 crore recovered in six phases so far under ‘Operation Mobile Shield’, says police officer

title: Thane authorities warn schools against banning Marathi, cite cultural disrespect
content: The Raj Thackeray-led MNS had alleged that some CBSE and ICSE schools in the district were penalising students for using Marathi, contributing to a growing cultural and linguistic imbalance

title: Maharashtra government reduces women’s welfare stipends, sparks political row
content: Women also receiving ₹1,000 through the Namo Shetkari Mahasanman Nidhi scheme will get only ₹500 instead of ₹1,500 through the State’s Mukhya Mantri Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana

title: 712 candidates get job offers in Srikalahasti
content: Srikalahasti MLA Bojjala Venkata Sudheer Reddy, who took up the initiative to boost employment opportunities in his constituency, personally hands over the offer letters to the selected candidates

title: CCTV must at temples, statues: Vizianagaram SP
content: SP Vakul Jindal said 3,000 CCTV cameras will be installed to deter vandalism at temples and statues of key figures in the district

title: Andhra Pradesh Cabinet authorises CRDA to take up construction of Legislative Assembly, High Court buildings
content: It also approves the proposal for establishment of a State Climate Centre and a host of power projects

title: Four YSRCP supporters held for ‘attack’ on Kurnool TDP office
content: The four accused entered the TDP office behind the DMart store on April 13 and attacked the TDP supporters there with sickles and knives.

title: Beware of child traffickers, SC cautions parents
content: Apex court says licence of hospitals will be suspended if newborns go missing; Bench asks HCs to ensure pending child-trafficking case trials are completed in six months

title: Health dept. issues alert against amoebic meningoencephalitis
content: As the water levels go down, people entering pools and rivers should be extremely careful as they  are more likely to come into contact with  amoeba in the muddy water, the concentration of which increases in the summer

title: Caste census report: Amid criticism, commission members say methodology was tried and tested
content: The process was conducted through government machinery in which about 1.30 lakh teachers were roped in, and the Indian Institute of Management, Bengaluru, studied the survey methodology and certified it

title: Perceived rise in hostility across north India alarms Catholics in Kerala
content: There’s a visible tendency among some self-proclaimed representatives of the majority religion to dominate minority communities, says Fr. Jose Vallikatt, a Catholic priest based in Bathinda

title: My father will become Bihar CM as promised by Amit uncle, says Nitish Kumar’s son Nishant
content: Several leaders of opposition Rashtriya Janata Dal including Tejashwi Yadav have been raising the apprehension that BJP will not continue with Nitish after the election

title: Aquaculture advisory panel to submit preliminary report on U.S. tariff crisis in Andhra Pradesh on April 16
content: State government tasks the Aquaculture Advisory Committee with studying U.S. tariff crisis, new market avenues, ways to increase domestic consumption, creating a corpus fund and cultivating antibiotic-free products

title: Tree cutting permits being used as carte blanche for illegal logging of the Nilgiris’ forests, allege activists
content: Armed with an order for the felling of 40 trees, the contractor is alleged to have used the permission to fell more than 250 trees in the area; his recklessness led him to accidentally trespass within the boundaries of the buffer zone of MTR

title: Maharashtra Cabinet approves compensation policy for custodial deaths
content: The weekly Cabinet meeting, chaired by Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, also cleared five other proposals across departments

title: Civic organisation opposes move to convert green park into market
content: Several trees are being cut on 22 acres of land at Edamalaipatti Pudur under the pretext of transplantation to convert the space into a vegetable market, says Inherency Protection League

title: New private homeopathy college sanctioned for Chittoor district
content: The private college, which will be run by the Srinivasa Education Society, will bear the name ‘Venkateswara Homeopathy Medical College and Hospital’ and will admit 100 students every year

title: Judge keeps charges vs. driver in Gaudreau case
content: A judge rejected a defense argument that the Gaudreau brothers contributed to their deaths by cycling while impaired and upheld all charges against the driver, including manslaughter.

title: Mavs' Harrison has 'no regrets' after Luka trade
content: Mavericks general manager Nico Harrison said he has "no regrets on the trade" that sent franchise cornerstone Luka Doncic to the Lakers. Instead, Harrison preached patience and the importance of defense while addressing the media Tuesday.

title: Sources: Bucks' Lillard to miss start of playoffs
content: Bucks star Damian Lillard will miss the start of the NBA playoffs because of a blood clot in his right calf, sources told ESPN.

title: Lions' Arnold honoring late teammate with No. 6
content: Lions cornerback Terrion Arnold opened up on the "New Wave Podcast" about honoring late Alabama teammate Khyree Jackson with his switch to the No. 6.

title: Star of stars: Crosby cleans up in NHLPA voting
content: Penguins star Sidney Crosby was named the league's most complete player in the NHLPA's annual player poll.

title: Sources: Dumars near deal to be Pels' president
content: Naismith Hall of Famer Joe Dumars is finalizing a deal to become the new president of basketball operations for the New Orleans Pelicans, sources told ESPN.

title: 'It was Paige and Paige only': Wings land Bueckers
content: Paige Bueckers, coming off leading UConn to its first national championship in nine years, was selected No. 1 by the Dallas Wings in the 2025 WNBA draft Monday night.

title: Former NFL TE Hasselbeck, father of QBs, dies
content: Former NFL tight end Don Hasselbeck, who won a Super Bowl in his nine-year career and was the father of two NFL quarterbacks, died Monday. He was 70.

title: How Tennessee coach Josh Heupel scored one for coaches everywhere
content: Nico Iamaleava is a seminal figure, somehow representing both ends of the pendulum swing of player empowerment.

title: NBA experts' picks for Warriors-Grizzlies and every play-in showdown
content: Our experts pick which teams make it out of the play-in tournament and which will survive the first round.

title: 'There's no justification for this': What comes next for the flailing Phoenix Suns -- and Kevin Durant
content: After firing their third coach in three years, the Suns' next -- and perhaps only -- move is trading the superstar whom owner Mat Ishbia acquired just hours after buying the team: Kevin Durant.

title: Why Luis Robert Jr. could be MLB trade deadline's most sought-after slugger
content: He had a disastrous 2024, but if Robert can play to his potential, the phones in Chicago will be ringing off the hook.

title: Iñigo Martínez gives new meaning to 'remontada' for Barcelona
content: It once looked like the ship to Barcelona had sailed for Iñigo Martínez. Now he's Barça's defensive leader, vital to their hopes of winning the treble.

title: Real Madrid's greatest Champions League comebacks
content: Arsenal beat Madrid 3-0 in the quarterfinal first leg, but history shows Los Blancos can never be counted out.

title: From A-plus Wings to C-minus Valkyries, grading every team's WNBA draft performance
content: Dallas, with Paige Bueckers at No. 1, and Washington, which got Sonia Citron at No. 3, got high marks in the WNBA draft.

title: Thousands of games, one-of-a-kind scores: Inside NBA 'scorigami'
content: Fueled by fast-paced play and unique scorelines, NBA scorigami has carved out a niche corner of basketball fandom.

title: Stanley Cup playoff watch: Your guide to the 10 games on Tuesday's schedule
content: Here's what is at stake in each matchup, with playoff seeding and draft lottery position on the line.

title: Meet the Wild's secret weapon -- who won't play a single minute this season
content: With a roster tight against the salary cap, the club has needed to make the most of its roster spots.

title: College baseball's next big thing: Rintaro Sasaki
content: Rintaro Sasaki chose to play for Stanford over going pro in Japan, so what exactly brought him to college baseball?

title: Women's college basketball transfer rankings: Fulwiley one of seven new players in top 25
content: South Carolina-bound Ta'Niya Latson tops the transfer rankings, but MiLaysia Fulwiley and Janiah Barker break into the top 10.

title: Winners and losers from the Masters, plus predictions for the rest of this year's majors

content: Before Cena dons the jorts a final time at WrestleMania, we look at 10 matches that have shaped his legacy.

content: DTs are getting paid big money, and the 2025 draft class is loaded. Will the draft reflect this is an elite position?

title: 30 years on, will Ki-Jana Carter be emulated by Ashton Jeanty?
content: Running backs are the strongest position group in this draft class. But will one get picked first ever again?

title: Bellingham: QF 2nd leg 'a night made for Madrid'
content: Jude Bellingham has said Wednesday's Champions League quarterfinal second leg against Arsenal is "a night made for Real Madrid."

title: Source: Onana feeling refreshed after time away
content: André Onana believes that time away from the Manchester United team has done him good, a source close to the goalkeeper has told ESPN.

title: Suárez: Messi wants to play at 2026 World Cup
content: Argentina captain Lionel Messi wants to play at the 2026 World Cup, according to his Inter Miami teammate and friend Luis Suarez.

title: 'Anything is possible,' Madrid site warns Arsenal
content: Real Madrid's website defiantly told fans that "anything is possible" before they attempt to overcome a three-goal deficit to Arsenal in the Champions League.

title: 'Urban warfare': Rome mayor slams derby clashes
content: The toll from clashes between violent fans and police at the weekend's Rome derby includes 24 law enforcement officers injured, one arrest and at least $45,000 in damaged garbage dumpsters.

title: Szczesny: Will accept No. 2 role if Flick wishes
content: Barcelona goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny said on Monday he will accept being dropped for Marc-André ter Stegen if that is what coach Hansi Flick decides.

title: Heaps: Been trash talking Fox before UWCL semis
content: Lyon midfielder Lindsey Heaps has said it is "special" to see her USWNT teammates Emily Fox and Jenna Nighswonger make the move over to play in Europe

title: FIFA plan LAFC vs. Club América CWC playoff
content: FIFA president Gianni Infantino said they will look to hold a playoff between Los Angeles FC and Club América for a place at the Club World Cup.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal join Chelsea in race for Barcelona's Koundé
content: Arsenal are ready to fight Chelsea to sign Jules Koundé from Barcelona. Transfer Talk has the latest news and gossip.

content: This spring, in addition to being named head coach of the Las Vegas Raiders, Carroll has been moonlighting as a college professor.
